sources.title: Castle Keep (1969) Burt Lancaster Â· Patrick O'Neal
sources.description: Towards the end of World War II, a group of wounded American soldiers is transferred to a castle in the Ardennes. Their days of rest, filled with boredom and sex, come to a bloody end when the major entrenches himself against the advancing German troops... A war film, uncertainly staged between sensationalism and criticism, that revels in destructive fury toward the end.

metadata.Plot: Toward the end of World War II, a small company of American GI's occupy an ancient castle. Their commander has an affair with the countess in resident. One guy falls in love with a Volkswagon. A baker among them moves in with another baker's wife. A group of shell shocked holy rollers wander the bombed out streets. A GI art historian tries vainly to protect the castle and its masterpieces.
metadata.Writer: William Eastlake, Daniel Taradash, David Rayfiel
metadata.Actors: Burt Lancaster, Patrick O'Neal, Jean-Pierre Aumont
